About Me

"It's not that I'm so smart, it's just that I stay with problems longer." -- Albert Einstein

After obtained my Ph.D. degree in Biology from Tsinghua University, I became a Postdoctoral Fellow at Ichan School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, Akar Lab. I kept on learning new skills and built my own workstation for large-scale gene sequencing analysis. With the help of my new skills, I published many research papers on prestige journals and was invited as the editor and reviewer for the journals. The Google Scholar records all my published papers. As an alien of extraordinary ability, I was granted permanent residency via EB-1A. I knew I couldn't teach myself everything I wanted to learn, so I went back to Columbia University for the Master degree in Computer Science. In 2018, I worked as a Software Engineer & Research Scientist at Graphen. Inc. In the AI startup company, my work involves both product development and onsite project consulting.
